t: How*pn beautiful your sandaled feet, O*ld prince’s daughter! Your*ln graceful legs are like jewels, the*ld work of an artist’s hands.
Your*ln navel is a rounded goblet that*ld never lacks blended wine. Your*ln waist is a mound of wheat encircled*ld by lilies.
Your*ln breasts are like two fawns, like*ld twin fawns of a gazelle.
Your*ln neck is like an ivory tower. Your*ln eyes are the pools of Heshbon by*ld the gate of Bath Rabbim. Your*ln nose is like the tower of Lebanon looking*ld toward Damascus.
Your*ln head crowns you like Mount Carmel. Your*ld hair is like royal tapestry; the*ld king is held captive by its tresses.
How*ln beautiful you are and how pleasing, my*ld love, with your delights!
Your*ln stature is like that of the palm, and*ld your breasts like clusters of fruit.
I*ln said, “I will climb the palm tree; I*ld will take hold of its fruit.” May*ln your breasts be like clusters of grapes on the vine, the*ld fragrance of your breath like apples,
and*ld your mouth like the best wine.
May*pn the wine go straight to my beloved, flowing*ld gently over lips and teeth.
I*ln belong to my beloved, and*ld his desire is for me.
Come,*ln my beloved, let us go to the countryside, let*ld us spend the night in the villages.
Let*ln us go early to the vineyards to*ld see if the vines have budded, if*ln their blossoms have opened, and*ld if the pomegranates are in bloom— there*ld I will give you my love.
The*ln mandrakes send out their fragrance, and*ld at our door is every delicacy, both*ln new and old, that*ld I have stored up for you, my beloved.
